review: I have been very happy with my Fire TV except for one potentially serious problem.  The good is that most of the time it does what it is supposed to do at lightning fast speed.  Its interface is intuitive and easy to use.  Set-up was a breeze.  The bad: after about two months of service it began to give problems.  Buffering couldn't keep up with streaming even using a 75 Mbp wired connection .  Streaming was constantly being interrupted with error messages.  I tried resetting the Fire TV and my router plus all other recommended solutions.  The only thing that finally worked was unregistering and reregistering the Fire TV with Amazon.  I hope this is a firmware bug that Amazon will fix and that the problem does not recur.  Otherwise this potentially 5-star accessory will fall to 3-star or lower in my ratings.
author: Richard Rodewald

review: This is one of the best purchases I have made in a long while. Very easy to hook up and we were watching within minutes. We haven't watched anything on Amazon yet as we don't have Amazon Prime and most everything costs at least $2 to view. The voice search on the remote does work really well though. We bought Netflix and for $9 a month have more choices than we ever did with our satellite dish at about 8 times that cost. We may purchase Prime in the future, but for now we are very happy with the streaming capability of the Amazon Fire and the shows available on Netflix. Would be nice if the voice search worked for Netflix too, but you can't have everything.
author: R. Lindey
